ramanamaharshi_story.role: Modern Advaita Vedanta Sage, Teacher of Self-Inquiry

realization.event: Spontaneous awakening at age 16 after a near-death experience
realization.insight: Realized the Self as deathless, pure consciousness

coreidentity: Established Arunachala as a spiritual center

philosophicalthemes: Self alone is real; ego is an illusion

keyteachings.description: Investigate the source of the 'I' thought to realize the Self
True teaching is beyond words; silence conveys the highest truth
Complete surrender to the Self or God leads to liberation

textsandverses.name: Who am I?
textsandverses.meaning: Who am I? The core question for Self-Inquiry.

textsandverses.name: Upadesa Saram
textsandverses.meaning: Action yields fruit according to its nature; liberation comes only through knowledge.

textsandverses.name: Forty Verses
textsandverses.meaning: The 'I-I' shines as the Self when the ego subsides.

timeline.event: Born in Tiruchuli, Tamil Nadu in 1879
At age 16, experienced ego-death and awakening
Moved to Arunachala Hill; lived in caves in deep meditation
Taught Self-Inquiry through silence and brief instructions
Established Ramanashram; continued guiding seekers until Mahasamadhi in 1950
